result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance A. Heisz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terrance A. Heisz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Terrance A. Heisz was found guilty of Knowingly Operating While Suspended (Cause Death), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Amended on 07/11/2019:  sentence credit of 65 days granted.

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of any alcohol or any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Pay all supervision fees as required; participation and completion of any other counseling as deemed appropriate by DOC.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Terrance A. Heisz in court with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim's family present.  Atty Meyer-O'Day presents toxicology report and neuropsychology report to the Court for review.  PSI has been filed and reviewed.  Atty Meyer-O'Day advises Court of believed innaccuracies.  Request for testimony of Roy Heisz via phone; Court calls Mr. Heisz, sworn and testified.  Victim statements heard.  Arguments heard from State and defense.  Defendant makes statement to Court.  Court summons PSI writer, Agent J. Victora, to court.  Agent Victora is sworn and testified.  Defense request a new PSI be ordered.  State objects.  Court denies request for additional PSI.  Court sentences defendant:  5 years WSP - 2 initial confinement, 3 extended supervision; any/all counseling as requested, costs, absolute sobriety.  Defendant is eligible for SAP but not CIP.

PSI signed by Judge Sharp.

Defendant Terrance A. Heisz in court with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to suppress has been filed. Hearing on December 5, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court, defendant Terrance A. Heisz not in court, in custody in Clark County (rel. 12/05/2017).  Larry Eugene Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Meyer-O'Day does not object to today's testimony outside of hte presence of the defendant.  At next hearing, defendant will be asked to put waiver of appearance on record.   
DA Nelson requests to start with Motion to Excluse Evidence - calls Dr. G. Grunow as witness, sworn and testified.  Cross examination.  State calls Dr. M. Stier as witness, sworn and testified.  Cross examination.  State gives argument.  Defenese gives response.   In regards, second motion - State has nothing to add to brief, previously filed.  Defense concludes the same.  State/Defense project that ruling will result in interlocatory appeal either way.
Motion to Exclude Evidence on Impairment - State reserves right to Daubert attack.  Discussion.
  Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2017 at 09:30 am.
